intro: Juanulloa globifera, commonly known as the globeflower, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive spherical, fleshy fruits that resemble small globes, hence its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and numerous stamens. Juanulloa globifera is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks.
